column4: just set the access rights thing and tell me what you get
pastebin the output of : ls -lh ~/public_html and a2enmod plz
do you see userdir in the output of a2enmod?
what should i do with a2enmod? you have to excuse me, this is my first time using linux ^^
juste execute the command than Ctrl+c to abort :)

Your choices are: actions alias asis auth_basic auth_digest authn_alias authn_anon authn_dbd authn_dbm authn_default authn_file authnz_ldap authz_dbm authz_default authz_groupfile authz_host authz_owner authz_user autoindex cache cern_meta cgi cgid charset_lite dav dav_fs dav_lock dbd deflate dir disk_cache dump_io env expires ext_filter file_cache filter headers ident imagemap include info ldap log_forensic mem_cache mime mim
sudo a2enmod userdir than chmod -R 775 ~/public_html and chgrp -R www-data ~/publi_html
said userdir was already enabled, but ill do the other commands
i cannot execute "chgrp -R www-data ~/public_html" it says its not allowed
prepend sudo to all your commands
done and done, still getting the forbidden message tho
do i have to chmod ~ with 755 too?
nop, that's too dangerous... just the ~/public_html
sorry :) I messed up... that has no effects in your case
ok, well, apache still get permission denied, for ~/public_html
